intro: Chrysothamnus scopulorum, commonly known as the desert goldenbush, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, yellow-green foliage and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has adapted to harsh environments with its deep root system and ability to store water. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Chrysothamnus scopulorum plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
